intro: Uwarowia, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to tropical Africa. These plants are characterized by their thick, fleshy leaves and showy, often violet-colored flowers. Uwarowia species are typically herbaceous, with a short stem and a rosette of leaves that help conserve moisture. They thrive in humid, shaded environments and are popular as ornamental houseplants. The flowers are usually borne on tall, slender stalks and bloom in a variety of colors beyond just violet.
